page.title: 10Fulscot Farm, E. Hagbourne
page.content: This farm is mentioned in the original Domesday book. At that time there were 80 acres of meadow and 2 ploughs. Today the farm is 360acres, 150acres of marsh having been drained and fields enlarged There are 17 fields, each about 20 acres. 6 acres of trees were planted for shelter 20 yrs ago. The owners of the farm are Mrs Hedge her daughter Patricia. It is a mixed farm with wheat, barley, kale, oil seed rape and they have increased acreage crops by 1/3rd. In the winter they keep sheep and turkeys. Livestock numbers 150 head. They also keep dairy cattle and 13 calves are kept in an old oak and elm beamed barn dated 1803 which it is difficult to get modern machinery into.An average dairy cow weighs 16 kilos. Bulls are kept at the dairy. The livestock are fed on barley feed, sugar beet pellets and maize gluten from USA.
